episodeTitle: She Loves Sweets! Big Mom of the Four Emperors!
episodeTitleJapanese: お菓子好き！四皇ビッグ・マム
description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji recover Caribou's stolen treasure and encounter Big Mom Pirates members Pekoms and Tamago at the candy factory. When Luffy inadvertently reveals the Straw Hats ate the candy meant for Big Mom, he takes responsibility and boldly declares he will defeat the Emperor and claim Fish-Man Island as his territory.

events.title: Charlotte Linlin (Big Mom) First Appearance
events.description: Big Mom, one of the Four Emperors, makes her debut in the series. She appears in silhouette on Whole Cake Island, displaying her obsessive love for sweets and terrifying demeanor. Her massive size and pink bloodshot eyes are shown as she awaits the candy shipment from Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Introduces one of the series' most powerful antagonists and sets up the future Whole Cake Island arc. Establishes Big Mom's personality, power, and obsession with sweets that drives major plot points.

quotes.speaker: Big Mom
quotes.context: Big Mom demanding her candy tribute from Fish-Man Island

events.title: Charlotte Pudding First Appearance
events.description: Charlotte Pudding, one of Big Mom's daughters, makes her first appearance sitting near Big Mom on Whole Cake Island. At this point, her third eye is visible and she appears as a background character.
events.significance: First introduction of a character who becomes crucial during the Whole Cake Island arc, though her importance is not yet revealed. This is significant foreshadowing that pays off hundreds of episodes later.

events.title: Bobbin's Introduction
events.description: Bobbin, a combatant of the Big Mom Pirates with the epithet 'Sweeper', appears at Whole Cake Island and reports to Big Mom that he burned down a country that failed to make their monthly tribute payment.
events.significance: Demonstrates the brutal enforcement methods of the Big Mom Pirates and establishes the serious consequences of failing to pay tribute to a Yonko.

quotes.text: I destroyed the island and it smelled sweet when I did.
quotes.speaker: Bobbin
quotes.context: Reporting to Big Mom about punishing a country that didn't pay tribute

events.title: Napoleon's Silhouette Debut
events.description: Napoleon, Big Mom's bicorne hat homie, appears for the first time in silhouette form on Big Mom's head. At this point, it appears as a simple hat and its sentient nature is not yet revealed.
events.significance: First appearance of one of Big Mom's special homies, though its true nature as a living weapon won't be revealed until much later in the series.

events.title: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji Recover Caribou's Treasure
events.description: The trio finds Caribou unconscious on the main island with all the treasure he stole from Ryugu Palace spilled out from his Numa Numa no Mi powers. They eagerly collect the massive treasure haul to take back.
events.significance: This treasure becomes a key plot point when Luffy offers it to Big Mom as compensation for the eaten candy, though she refuses it.

events.title: Pekoms Debut
events.description: Pekoms, a lion mink and combatant of the Big Mom Pirates, makes his first full appearance at the candy factory on Fish-Man Island. He displays his intimidating presence and reveals he's there to collect the monthly candy tribute.
events.significance: First introduction of a mink character in the series and an important member of the Big Mom Pirates. Also establishes the tribute system Big Mom uses to 'protect' territories.

events.title: Baron Tamago Debut
events.description: Baron Tamago, a long-legged man wearing an eggshell and using a teacup and saucer as a hat, debuts alongside Pekoms at the candy factory. He demonstrates a more diplomatic approach compared to Pekoms' aggression.
events.significance: Introduces another key Big Mom Pirates member and showcases the diversity of Big Mom's crew. His egg-based abilities and transformations become important later.

events.title: Big Mom's Protection Racket Explained
events.description: The Minister of the Left explains that Big Mom claimed Fish-Man Island as her territory after Whitebeard's death, demanding 10 tons of candy monthly in exchange for protection. The candy factory was destroyed during Hody's rampage.
events.significance: Establishes how the Four Emperors operate in the New World through territory claims and tribute systems. Shows the power vacuum left by Whitebeard's death and how other Emperors moved to claim his territories.

quotes.text: Big Mom claimed this island as her territory after Whitebeard's death. In exchange for her protection, we must pay 10 tons of sweets every month.
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Left
quotes.context: Explaining the tribute arrangement to Pekoms and Tamago

events.title: Luffy Accidentally Reveals Eating the Candy
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji arrive at the candy factory with Caribou's treasure. Not realizing who Pekoms and Tamago are, Luffy enthusiastically shouts 'Thank you for the sweets, they were delicious!' revealing that the Straw Hats consumed the candy meant for Big Mom.
events.significance: This inadvertent admission creates a major diplomatic crisis and puts Fish-Man Island in danger. It's a classic Luffy moment where his honesty and lack of awareness creates problems.

quotes.text: Thank you for the sweets, they were delicious!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Unwittingly revealing to Big Mom's subordinates that the Straw Hats ate the candy

events.title: Den Den Mushi Call from Big Mom
events.description: Big Mom calls Pekoms and Tamago via Den Den Mushi to check on the candy delivery. The extended ringing sequence builds tension as both subordinates are terrified to answer, knowing they must deliver bad news to their volatile captain.
events.significance: Showcases the fear Big Mom inspires even in her own crew members. The anime extended this sequence from the manga to build dramatic tension.

events.title: Luffy Answers Big Mom's Call
events.description: When Pekoms and Tamago are too afraid to answer the Den Den Mushi, Luffy casually picks it up and speaks directly with Big Mom, taking full responsibility for eating the candy. He offers Caribou's treasure as compensation.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's fearlessness and willingness to take responsibility for his crew's actions. His casual attitude toward one of the world's most powerful pirates is classic Luffy behavior.

quotes.text: I ate all the candy! But don't worry, I'll give you this treasure instead!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Speaking directly to Big Mom via Den Den Mushi

events.title: Big Mom Refuses Treasure and Declares War on Luffy
events.description: Despite Tamago's recommendation to accept the valuable treasure, Big Mom refuses the substitution. She declares that she wanted candy specifically and announces her intention to pursue Luffy in the New World as punishment.
events.significance: Establishes Big Mom's stubborn nature and her irrational obsession with sweets over material wealth. This decision sets up the eventual Whole Cake Island arc and Big Mom's pursuit of the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: I don't want treasure! I want candy! I'll come after you in the New World, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Big Mom
quotes.context: Refusing Luffy's offer and declaring her intent to pursue him

events.title: Luffy Declares War on Big Mom
events.description: In response to Big Mom's threat, Luffy boldly declares that he will defeat her and claim Fish-Man Island as his own territory. This is a direct challenge to one of the Four Emperors, shocking everyone present.
events.significance: One of the most important moments in the series, as Luffy directly challenges a Yonko for the first time. This declaration sets up major future arcs and shows Luffy's growth in ambition and confidence as he enters the New World.

quotes.text: I'm going to beat you and make Fish-Man Island my territory!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration of war against Big Mom

events.title: Pekoms and Tamago's Shock at Luffy's Declaration
events.description: Pekoms and Tamago are left stunned and horrified by Luffy's bold declaration against their captain. They recognize this as an unprecedented direct challenge to a Yonko from a rookie pirate.
events.significance: Emphasizes how audacious Luffy's declaration is and foreshadows the coming conflict. The reactions of experienced pirates highlight just how dangerous this challenge is.

events.title: Big Mom Eats Her Own Crew Members
events.description: In a shocking display of her cruelty and instability, Big Mom is shown eating some of her own crew members who failed to meet her expectations. This establishes her as an unpredictable and terrifying ruler.
events.significance: Demonstrates Big Mom's volatile nature and the constant danger her crew faces. This moment establishes her as one of the most frightening antagonists in the series.

quotes.text: I destroyed the island and it smelled sweet when I did.
quotes.speaker: Bobbin
quotes.context: Reporting to Big Mom about destroying a country that didn't pay tribute

quotes.text: Big Mom claimed this island as her territory after Whitebeard's death. In exchange for her protection, we must pay 10 tons of sweets every month.
quotes.speaker: Minister of the Left

quotes.text: Thank you for the sweets, they were delicious!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Accidentally revealing to Big Mom's subordinates that the Straw Hats ate the candy

quotes.text: I ate all the candy! But don't worry, I'll give you this treasure instead!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: I don't want treasure! I want candy! I'll come after you in the New World, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Big Mom
quotes.context: Refusing the treasure and threatening Luffy

quotes.text: I'm going to beat you and make Fish-Man Island my territory!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: Luffy takes full responsibility for his crew eating the candy, demonstrating his growth as a captain and willingness to face the consequences of his actions.
themes.symbolism: The Den Den Mushi represents the connection between old world power (Big Mom) and the new generation (Luffy).

themes.description: Luffy's declaration against Big Mom represents the new generation's challenge to the established power structure of the Four Emperors.
themes.symbolism: Fish-Man Island as territory represents the clash between old world powers and Luffy's rising influence.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the terror Big Mom inspires in her subordinates with Luffy's fearless attitude, highlighting his unique character.
themes.symbolism: The ringing Den Den Mushi symbolizes impending doom that Luffy fearlessly confronts.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows Luffy's fearlessness and willingness to challenge the most powerful figures in the world. His casual attitude toward Big Mom demonstrates his confidence as he enters the New World.
keyActions: Answers Big Mom's call without fear
Declares war on Big Mom and claims Fish-Man Island
quotes: Thank you for the sweets, they were delicious!
I'm going to beat you and make Fish-Man Island my territory!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a terrifying and irrational Yonko with an obsessive love for sweets. Her volatile nature and power are established through her crew's fear and her brutal actions.
keyActions: Demands candy shipment from Fish-Man Island
Declares intent to pursue Luffy in the New World
quotes: I don't want treasure! I want candy! I'll come after you in the New World, Straw Hat!

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a loyal and intimidating member of Big Mom's crew, though he shows fear when dealing with his captain. First mink character shown in the series.
keyActions: Arrives at Fish-Man Island to collect candy
Too afraid to answer Big Mom's call

characterSpotlights.development: Shows a more diplomatic and calculating approach compared to Pekoms. Recognizes the value of the treasure but ultimately defers to Big Mom's wishes.
keyActions: Arrives at Fish-Man Island with Pekoms
Attempts to negotiate with Minister of the Left

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the Den Den Mushi ringing sequence, building more tension before Luffy answers the call.
The anime added additional scenes showing Shirahoshi's concern for Luffy's safety after his declaration.

trivia.fact: This episode marks Big Mom's first appearance, over 10 years before her eventual defeat in episode 1066.
Charlotte Pudding's third eye is visible in this episode, years before it becomes a major plot point in the Whole Cake Island arc.

sources.title: One Piece: Charlotte Pudding's Big Plot Twist Was Revealed Before Whole Cake Island Arc

trivia.fact: Toshiko Fujita voiced Big Mom during the Fish-Man Island arc, but Mami Koyama would later take over the role for the Whole Cake Island arc.
This episode adapts Chapter 651, titled 'The Voice From the New World', covering pages 3-19.
Pekoms is the first mink character to appear in the One Piece anime.
The opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was used from episodes 517-590, covering the entire Fish-Man Island saga.
